question: Activated protein C inhibit clotting mechanism by inactivating which of the following clotting factors:
exp: Protein-C is a vitamin K-dependent protease that requires a cofactor (Protein S). Activated Protein C/protein S forms a complex which is a potent inhibitor of coagulation factors Va and Factor VIIIa. Protein C acts as a Tissue factor pathway inhibitor (TFPI)

question: Vitamin required for bone formation as well as coagulation cascade is:
exp: Vitamin K is the cofactor for g-carboxylation of glutamate residues of protein to produce g-carboxy glutamate (gla). This process is known as Vitamin K epoxide cycle. Clotting factors contain 4 to 6 g-carboxyglutamate residues:- Eg- II VII IX X Protein C Protein S Protein Z Osteocalcin Transthyretin (Prealbumin)

question: Which of the coagulation factor is least affected in a patient with vitamin K deficiency?
exp: Factor VIII Patient with vitamin K deficiency will have mostly involvement of dependent clotting factors. I. e. Factors II, VII, IX & X
